comment: but the girls do well for themselves & damndotheylookgood
if only everyone had astute self-awareness abilities
but then who would be our entertainment?
finally finished an art i can share here :ctwokinds-natsducky:
ok so they fixed the slicer
the hot case went out and all the coolers & fridges went down
I saw a dudes license plate was 'swole'. the interwebs be leaking
hoi peeps *slowly slithers out of bed*
Dear god I've fully embraced the gag XD
Finally watched the Twisted Tea SMACK vidya
I realized I accidentially bought the sugar free puddings
Next two weeks are gonna be a whole bunch of *sigh*
Majority of my shifts are the exact one that pushed me to find another job in the first place
At least the final one will be chill
like a boss rush, but less fun
If I had to put my current shift on a tier list of undesirables
It'd probably be second right below overnight :/
I think my new favorite snacking fruit are blackberries
not too sweet, just the right size
Maybe I’ve just never had good ones, but the recent pickinggs seem :ok_hand:
the hot case was fine but everything in the coolers and freezers had to be tossed & replaced in the whole store including the meat/cheese case
supervisor came by 30 minutes after I’ve clocked in & says shut down since we can’t use anything and I got all the dishes geared to go and was close to cleaning the fryer & rotisserie & it’s spool
So early day or just different assignment?
but the guy seems the hot case ok - other person with me ends up going to the store manager who of course didn’t say to shut down & will and has never or ever
so we have to restart everything
there’s no closer because who was supposed to be was in fact scheduled wrong - he no longer works in our department
I brought this up a week ago because I was set 1-9, he 1-10, last person was set to leave at 6
either call another person in or reconfigure the schedule
never happened, ergo we have today

not only did all the cleaning if done be for nothing, I also had to stop mid stocking like the supervisor had told me to do while the other person (due to leave at 6) did all the closing while she was at lunch
because we were told to start back up
^ok person leaving at 6 was to do the closing while I stocked when she got back from her lunch
Is part of the problem holiday schedules? Is there more people usually or will that be a recurring thing?
manager came in - when I was told she’d be here at 3 (she was not)
so she helped close but in the end I closed
they had to call her in
I was told she’d be there at 3 - whether that was the case & she was due then and just couldn’t get out of her dr appointment as fast as she - and we - would like is beyond me
also, of course they came in and asked if I’d take the empty shift tomorrow because they have a new person scheduled to close & she doesn’t know how
& they’d rather me show her the ropes
I’m about to demand some manager-level pay or something
yeah I’m shocked with all those major unforeseen failures a manager should have been around
they have me do counts for raw chickens, maintain SPARK, and effectively babysit
Should get a thank you or a bonus or something
I shit you not I had 3 customers hone in on me to ask questions and if the department manager isn’t in the area, I’m the one asked any questions should another worker be lost
yeah holidays at work in my experience so far are either suspiciously quiet or a complete unpredictable disaster
it’s like I have “encyclopedia” written on me somewhere
This year even on my end is more toward the disater end of the spectrum
it’s the kind of times when hearing your name gives you ptsd
At least being a reliable and dedicated worker are good, recognizable traits.
but at some point too much is too much
no I walked in and started stocking bread for the hell of it
today, with a billion other things to do, I had a guy ask what each thing was in the case
despite the signs labeling what’s in the pans
I gave up halfway and just pointed out what was what individually
Was he looking for like commentary or recommendations?
I don’t know - he usually gets hot wings but we’re out
so he had to get a summary of what else was there I guess
“None of those things sound like ‘hot wings’”
“...do you have any more hot wings yet?”
I don’t mind spending time to help customers or people in general but it’s just I literally don’t have the time
especially during the heat of the holidays or busy hours and we have like
Let alone without all the extra complications
Just offer pesky customers a piece of cheese
that usually occupies most ppl for a fair bit
guy wanted an 8 piece which the other person I was with was about to cook & the last seconds before it’s done he’s swung back by & is trying to talk to me
he apparently thought he was rushing me but it like no dude, I just have chickens to take off the rotisserie, a lady is wanting two of them so there’s that to consider, and there’s your order
does he want burnt food, cuz yeah that’s how he’ll get burnt food
which, I can’t leave hot or cold food out sitting for longer than 20 minutes, regardless of what else I have to do
I experience that at work too, I swear sometimes people don’t realize that it isn’t YOU that has to do the work that they just asked for
that starter makes my eye twitch
especially when it’s can you make me a tray or bucket or order of some sort
don’t get mad if I say it’ll be a wait
Yeah it’s like they think you push like a button just to accomplish everything they could possibly ask for
good thing about masks is the demand for smiles is pretty much dead
I’m engaging as I can be with all I have to do and so on, so forth
I’m not always smiles and unicorns prancing through sunflower meadows with a rainbow in the background
yeah you would think people would want to linger around as little as possible
sometimes I’m strictly jumping from customer to customer, task to task, customer to task, etc
Not when you have cakes, deli service and like hot foods to worry about
That’s like a full service restaurant menu
nothing gives me a more fierce, cardinal urge to throw something very heavy at another humans head
Like typical super markets even it’s like one type of thing counter
I mean just like someone who has to take orders at a phone and counter at like a sub shop, yeah they’re dashing around crazy at high times
And honestly, most people should just expect an order to be taken
not a guided tour of everything all the time
back to whatever tea time was happening before my stampede came barreling in
..did it get busted across somebody’s face
